advice: I hope DaWanda is not the next Enron.
cons: The *most successful* people at DaWanda are those who complain the whole time, but stay quiet when the decision makers are in the room.
pros: Work-Life balance
text: Pros Work-Life balance A nice looking office The Snuggery The Marketing/PR/Design department: Thanks to you I was part of building the most-loved German brand, and I am very proud of it! The PR: the brand is so strong that no negative glassdoor article will have any influence on the press coverage. The further away from management, the better life is, as is shown in the ratings on Glassdoor Cons The *most successful* people at DaWanda are those who complain the whole time, but stay quiet when the decision makers are in the room. The worst time was when the sale/merger/exit/closure? of DaWanda fell through: The communication in the corridors was awful, everyone knew how much money was put into what, how little is on the bank account, that marketing presentations for investors were overblown, that fake roadmaps to please investors were put in place, bills were not paid, etc. Many people were fired, many left on their own account for better job security, their ethics, and no more negativity. Advice to Management I hope DaWanda is not the next Enron. You need to do so much more in order for the corridor talk to stop (i.e. exchange your most-trusted employees). Although it was at first interesting to hear all the gossip to know what is truly going on, it was at the same time awful and embarrassing to find out that I was working for such a company.
title: Good from far, but far from good

advice: Foster internal collaboration and communication and continue to drive change to make DaWanda an even more customer centric product and company.
cons: Change is good and necessary, yet it always creates friction and unfortunately comes with the loss of some good people along the way. Internal communication at DaWanda is far from perfect, yet I see progress - but it’s still a long way to go. This applies also to collaboration between teams which ranges from non-existent to super awesome.
pros: DaWanda enables creative people to make a living from their skills and passion, a purpose which I find extremely appealing. The business model is based on shared success - DaWanda as a company can only succeed when DaWanda sellers are successful. Therefore, it is encouraging to see that DaWanda has been implementing many changes with the ultimate goal to become a more customer centric organization. Furthermore, it is pretty awesome to work with talented and creative people with so many great ideas and an intrinsic motivation to deliver great customer value. While goals are ambitious and challenging at times, overall, I find my work-live balance to be well intact- due to flexible working hours, the possibility to work from home as well as a general agreement that working overtime should be the exception, not the rule.
